meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I dipt my brush in paint.
meanings.sent2: She dipt her cookie in milk before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef dipt his sleeve in the soup by accident.
meanings.sent4: The explorer dipt his hand into the river to test the temperature.
meanings.sent5: The child dipt her toes in the cool water of the pool.

meanings.definition: having been immersed in a liquid
meanings.sent1: The dipt cloth absorbed all the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The dipt sponge was heavy with cleaning solution.
meanings.sent3: The dipt towel hung on the line, dripping wet.
meanings.sent4: The dipt paintbrush left a trail of color on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The dipt flower petals glistened with morning dew.

meanings.definition: having been coated with a thin layer of a substance
meanings.sent1: The dipt pretzel was covered in chocolate.
meanings.sent2: The dipt apple was shiny with caramel.
meanings.sent3: The dipt candle smelled of sweet vanilla.
meanings.sent4: The dipt donut was sprinkled with colorful sugar.
meanings.sent5: The dipt strawberry was dipped in rich cream.
